schema.title: Show Status Bar
schema.description: Select to display the Status Bar along the bottom of the Kurzweil 3000 window.

schema.title: Show Ruler
schema.description:
Select to display a ruler across the top of text documents. 
You can use the ruler to set margins and tabs in your text documents.

schema.title: Units
schema.description: Select the measurement units used by the ruler.

schema.title: All Characters
schema.description: Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to speak each character as you type it.

schema.title: Whole Words
schema.description: Select to have Kurzweil 3000 to speak words after you type them followed by the Space Bar.

schema.title: Whole Sentences
schema.description: Select to have Kurzweil 3000 to speak sentences after you type them followed by the period.

schema.title: Remeber Last X File Names
schema.description: Directs Kurzweil 3000 to display recently accessed files. Type the number of files that you want Kurzweil 3000 to display.

schema.title: Speak Buttons
schema.description: Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to speak a toolbar buttons function as you pass the mouse cursor over it.

schema.title: Speak Messages
schema.description: Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to speak the contents of message boxes, such as warning messages.

schema.title: Large Message Boxes
schema.description: Select to increase the size of the text that Kurzweil 3000 uses to display the contents of message boxes.

schema.title: Drag-Drop Enabled
schema.description:
Select to allow drag-and-drop operations.
This allows you to disable drag and drop for users who have difficulties using a mouse.

schema.title: Show Open Column Note Dialog
schema.description: Enable this option to have the Column Notes dialog appear upon opening documents. If only one Column Notes file exists, it will open.

schema.title: My Zoom Value
schema.description: Enter a number (between 25 and 1000) for the My Zoom command.

schema.title: Language
schema.description:
Choose the language of the document that you want Kurzweil 3000 to read.

The selected language should match the Language selection in the OCR area of the Scanning pane.

This will happen automatically if the Change when reading language option is selected in the Scanning pane, which it is by default.

schema.title: Speaker
schema.description: Choose a speaking voice.

schema.title: Speed
schema.description: Use the slider to specify how fast Kurzweil 3000 should read documents

schema.title: Auto-Scroll Images
schema.description:
Select to enable auto-scrolling.

Auto-scrolling directs Kurzweil 3000 to automatically scroll past images as it encounters them during reading.

schema.title: Auto-Scroll Images by:
schema.description:
Choose scroll by Pages to force Kurzweil 3000 to scroll to the top of the document window, the line of text immediately following an image. Choose this option if the text contains images that do not directly pertain to the text being read.

Choose scroll by Lines to cause Kurzweil 3000 to scroll the document ahead to the next line of text following an image. Choose this option if  you want images to stay in view as Kurzweil 3000 reads text.

schema.title: Silent if Minimized
schema.description:
Select to pause reading when you minimize the Kurzweil 3000 application. If the option is not selected, Kurzweil 3000 continues reading when you minimize it.

Note. This option has no effect on document windows. If you minimize a document window, reading stops.

schema.title: Pause at Bookmarks
schema.description:
Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to stop reading  at each Bookmark it encounters in a document.

This allows you to click on the Bookmark, hear its contents, and resume reading.

schema.title: Pause at Empty Notes
schema.description:
Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to stop reading when it encounters an empty note in a document.

Empty notes are frequently added to the blank answer lines in tests. Using this option allows Kurzweil 3000 to read a test question, and then pause at the location where the answer should be typed.

schema.title: Read Footnotes when Opened
schema.description: Select to have Kurzweil 3000 read a Footnote aloud when you click its anchor.

schema.title: Read Voice Notes in place
schema.description: Select to have Kurzweil 3000 play Voice Notes when it encounters them during reading.

schema.title: Read Work when Double Clicked
schema.description: Select to have Kurzweil 3000 read words when double-clicked.

schema.title: Highlight Spoken Word
schema.description:
Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to highlight the word it is currently reading.

The color used for highlighting words in image documents is controlled with the Reading option in Image pane of the Options dialog. The color used for highlighting words in text documents is controlled with the Word option in the Text pane of the Options dialog.

schema.title: Skip Reading Headers/Footers
schema.description: Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to read areas of the page that have be marked using the Header/Footer Editor.

schema.title: Resume Reading On Start Up
schema.description: You are prompted when you launch Kurzweil 3000 to choose whether you want to resume reading the document you last read when you exited the program. Uncheck if you no longer want to be prompted whether to resume reading the last read document.

schema.title: Read the Web
schema.description: Select Google Chrome (Chrome), or Mozilla Firefox (Firefox) as the default browser for the Kurzweil 3000 Read the Web application. The browser you select as your default will then automatically open when you select Read the Web in Kurzweil 3000. If you haven't already installed the Read the Web extension on Chrome or Firefox, the links below the default browser buttons take you to the browser of your choice and display the instructions for downloading and installing the Read the Web extension.

schema.title: Text
schema.description: Choose a text color for the document.

schema.title: Background
schema.description: Choose a background color for the document.

schema.title: Word
schema.description: Choose a color for Kurzweil 3000 to use to highlight the word it is currently reading.

schema.title: Unit
schema.description: Choose a color for Kurzweil 3000 to use to highlight the selected Reading Unit during reading.

schema.title: Font
schema.description: Choose the font for document content.

schema.title: Size
schema.description: Choose the font size for document content.

schema.title: Bold
schema.description: Enable bold font style

schema.title: Italitc
schema.description: Enable italic font style

schema.title: Underline
schema.description: Enable font underline style

schema.title: Mode
schema.description:
Highlight Mode. Choose how you want Kurzweil 3000 to highlight the Word and Unit during reading.

Choose Color Words to apply the selected Word and Unit colors to only the words and leave the background set to the currently selected Background color.

Choose Color Background to apply the selected Word color to the word that Kurzweil 3000 is reading, and apply the selected Unit color to color the Reading Unit.

schema.title: Word Spacing
schema.description: Increases or decreases the spacing between words. The value is added to, or subtracted from the standard word spacing applied by the selected font.

schema.title: Auto-Backup Open Text Files
schema.description: Enabled by default to save your open text files by the default of every 5 minutes. It's a good idea to keep this option enabled. To change the minute option, click in its box and type a number.

schema.title: Backup interval
schema.description: Choose how frequently open files are backed up

schema.title: Reading
schema.description: Choose a reading color pair for Kurzweil 3000 to use to highlight the current word and Reading Unit during reading.

schema.title: Selection
schema.description: Choose a color to use when you click and drag with the mouse to highlight an area of text.

schema.title: Background
schema.description:
Choose a color to apply as the background color for black and white image documents.

The background color is only applied to areas of the document that do not contain gray-scaling or dithered areas. This option is useful, for example, with test documents, which usually contain a lot of white space. Changing the background color may make it easier in cases where visual acuity is an issue.

schema.title: Caret
schema.description: Choose a color for the caret/cursor.

schema.title: Outline Colors
schema.description: Select to place a dark outline around the reading color pair, selection area, and caret/cursor.

schema.title: Image Reader converts to text
schema.description: Image Reader converts to image to text

schema.title: Caret Width
schema.description:
Use the slider to change the width of the caret/cursor that Kurzweil 3000 uses to identify your current location in the document.

Its default value is 3.

schema.title: Default Fit
schema.description: Choose a page fit option that Kurzweil 3000 uses to size image documents within the Kurzweil 3000 window.

schema.title: Note Marker Size
schema.description: Choose a size to display Bookmark, Voice Note, and Footnote markers.

schema.title: Fill in the Blanks
schema.description: Choose the Note type (Text Notes or Voice Notes) that Kurzweil 3000 inserts when you use the Fill in the Blanks feature. The default is Text Notes.

schema.title: Preserve Line Breaks on Copy, Extract or Save as Text
schema.description: Select  to preserve line breaks in an image document when performing one of these operations.

schema.title: Override saved document page zoom level
schema.description: Select to override the stored per-page zoom settings.

schema.title: Text
schema.description: Choose a color for the text

schema.title: Background
schema.description: Choose a color for the background

schema.title: Font
schema.description: Choose a font.

schema.title: Show Image in Image Files
schema.description:
When reading image documents, select to show the image text in the Magnify Spoken Word window, as opposed to the underlying text.

In some cases, Kurzweil 3000 might not be able to recognize the image text well enough to display it in the Magnify Spoken Word window. This can result in only black boxes appearing in the window.

schema.title: Limit Spelling Suggestions
schema.description:
Choose  Always to limit suggestions to what is in the American Heritage Children’s Dictionary.

Choose  Never to  limit the suggestions, in which case, Kurzweil 3000 presents all of the suggestions from the Spell Check database.

Choose  Add option to spelling window to add a button to the Spelling Correction dialog box that lets you select between the Never and Always settings as you spell check a document.

schema.title: English Dialect
schema.description:
Specify the dialect Kurzweil 3000 uses to check English language documents. The default dialect is American English, which you can change to British English.

Note: This option is not available with non-English versions of Kurzweil 3000.

schema.title: Check spelling as you type
schema.description: Selected by default to have Kurzweil 3000 indicate misspelled words as you type.

schema.title: Add new words as they are typed
schema.description: Add new words as they are typed to add words to the Word Prediction dictionary as you type them. This is on by default.

schema.title: Add new words automatically when checking spelling
schema.description: Add new words automatically when spell checking to automatically add new words to the Word Prediction dictionary as you add them during Spell Checking. This is on by default.

schema.title: Train on words not in spell-check dictionary (after a warning)
schema.description: Train on words not in spell-check dictionary to add words that are not in the Spelling dictionary when using the Train function.

schema.title: Add words to spelling dictionary also
schema.description: Also, select the Add words to Private spelling dictionary checkbox to add words, such as proper nouns, that are spelled correctly, but are not in the main spell-check dictionary.

schema.title: Use phonetic spelling for work prediction lookup
schema.description: Use phonetic spelling... selected by default to present possible alternative words from the phonetic spelling list.

schema.title: Brightness
schema.description:
Use the Brightness slider to choose a brightness setting for your scanner.

Lower values result in darker scanned images; higher values result in lighter scanned images. Some scanners may not look for this setting.

Its default setting is 50.

schema.title: Save Setting
schema.description: Select to save and use the Brightness setting for all subsequent scanning with Kurzweil 3000.

schema.title: Repeated Scan Delay
schema.description: Use the Repeated Scan Delay slider to specify the number of seconds the system waits between scans when you are using repeated scan mode.

schema.title: Page Orientation
schema.description:
Choose the page orientation that matches the way you place pages on the scanner glass.

The default,  Auto-Rotate, forces Kurzweil 3000 to determine the orientation. By specifying the actual orientation, you can speed up scanning.

schema.title: PDF Handling
schema.description: Select the PDF handling mode.

schema.title: Engine
schema.description:
Choose OCR recognition engine. 

The default is FineReader.

schema.title: Speed
schema.description: Select the speed at which you want to scan.

schema.title: Language
schema.description:
Select the recognition language(s) for the documents you scan.

The language chosen here must match the language chosen under Language in the Reading tab page.

schema.title: Change with reading language
schema.description: Change the scanning language with the reading language selected in the Reading tab.

schema.title: Find columns
schema.description:
Select to help Kurzweil 3000 recognize and read pages that have more than one column of text.

This is helpful for reading documents like newspapers and magazines. It is usually best to leave this box checked. It is sometimes helpful to turn it off if your scanning tables, as Kurzweil 3000 might separate the columns.

schema.title: Deskew
schema.description:
Select to ensures that a scanned page is in square.

Kurzweil 3000 deskews pages by default. In some cases, a page may still appear crooked or skewed. If this happens, you can try to deselect this option and rescan.

schema.title: Despeckle
schema.description: Select to enhance the recognition of  text printed on top of  backgrounds that make it hard to see the characters. This is the case with text printed on a background of small, colored dots, or with text printed on speckled paper, like newspaper.

schema.title: Dynamic Thresholding
schema.description: Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to break up each page into regions and automatically set a thresholding level that suits each region. One page can end up having several different thresholds.

schema.title: Show TWAIN UI
schema.description:
Select to direct Kurzweil 3000 to display the selected scanner’s TWAIN interface during scanning.

This can provide access to scanner settings not available with Kurzweil 3000. Not all scanners provide a TWAIN interface.

schema.title: Confidence Threshold
schema.description: Directs Kurzweil 3000 to identify image documents (when displayed in Thumbnail View) whose quality falls below  the specified threshold value. The default is 95.

schema.title: Review Items
schema.description: Add items to your document review checklist.
schema.default:
writingtoolsprchkitem0=listen to your written work
writingtoolsprchkitem1=check spelling
writingtoolsprchkitem2=check punctuation
writingtoolsprchkitem3=verify capitalization
writingtoolsprchkitem4=check word list(s)
writingtoolsprchkdscrp0=to listen to your written work, click the read button or f3.
writingtoolsprchkdscrp1=click at the beginning of the document, press shift+f8 keyboard shortcut, then click the spell check button in the writing toolbar.
writingtoolsprchkdscrp2=click at the beginning of the document, then click read to read through the document and check for proper punctuation.
writingtoolsprchkdscrp3=click at the beginning of the document, then click read to read through the document and check for capital letters at the beginning of sentences and for proper nouns.
writingtoolsprchkdscrp4=click in the document. next, click the floating word lists tool button, and select the tab for the word list you want. the words you used in the document highlight in the word list.
